means: 体育运动的运动（代表）队
（对付某类犯罪活动的）警察队伍

sentence.Network_en: Fraud squad officers had bugged the phone and were ready to pounce.
sentence.Network_cn: 反诈骗小组的警员们已在电话上安装了窃听器，并随时准备突击。

sentence.Network_en: He was in contention for a place in the European championship squad.
sentence.Network_cn: 他有望在欧洲锦标赛代表队中获得一席之地。

sentence.Network_en: Murat had looked into the eyes of the firing squad without flinching.
sentence.Network_cn: 穆拉特毫不退缩地直视着执行枪决的行刑队员们的眼睛。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: shortening of French escouade, variant of escadre, from Italian squadra 'square'

entry.tran: (专门处理某类犯罪的)警察分队
entry.def: A squad is a section of a police force that is responsible for dealing with a particular type of crime.

example.ex: The building was evacuated and the bomb squad called...
example.tran: 大楼里进行了人员疏散，并叫来了拆弹小组。

example.ex: The club is under investigation by the fraud squad.
example.tran: 反诈骗调查组正在对该俱乐部进行调查。

entry.tran: (将从中挑选运动员组队参赛的)运动队，大名单
entry.def: A squad is a group of players from which a sports team will be chosen.

example.ex: Sean O'Leary has been named in the England squad to tour Argentina.
example.tran: 肖恩·奥利里已入选参加阿根廷巡回赛的英格兰队大名单。

entry.def: A squad of soldiers is a small group of them.

auth_sentence.content: She will certainly have a great squad of players.
auth_sentence.res_content: She will certainly have a great squad of players.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She will certainly have a great squad of players.

auth_sentence.content: We're leaving my successor with an excellent squad.

jushi.english: Our advance forces encountered a squad of enemy patrols.
jushi.chinese: 我军的先头部队和敌军的一个班巡逻兵遭遇。
